div1.p: Hopes to finish the clean up work early; received galley proof of his lectures.

div1.head: Letter from H. R. Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, October 7, 1914
div1.p:
I wrote to you last night - & put your letter
in my pocket where I found it when I
put on my coat this evening. I am sorry
as that means a days delay. I expect that
you will get the same mail as this.

Dr Rankin is expected tomorrow, who will
work with me for a few days. This will
make work pleasanter & possibly somewhat
shorter. We had a pretty good day today
The lest we have had & better I judge than
we will have again. “Cleaned up” five
places - t two only were done yesterday & two Monday
afternoon = 9 out of 23 which we have on
our list - & there are some not yet listed
- 35 Mr Tillery told me in all. I think I can
get through in 10 days from the date
of arrival - instead of 14 as I expected. I
hope so any way as I judge I will have
to return to testify in court - on my fin-
dings & I do not want to give them more than
15 or at most 20 days of my time.

I am not tired tonight but I am going
to bed at 8 30/10 & it is 8. 20 now. So good
night my dear

I have rec'd no letter from Balt, - except
the Gally proof of my lectures- which ar-
rived last night & which I returned tonight
I do so hate to be away from home
Love to all of you. I judge Mary is with you
